intro: Liabum tovarense, commonly known as the Madagascar bean or Tovarense legume, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces slender, woody pods containing edible seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
